text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Bahraini press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Bahrain celebrates the arrival of its frigate Sabha from the United Sates.
- The electricity and water minister signed a 508,000 dinar agreement with German engineering consultancy firm Fichtner.
- A Gulf Arab banking conference on strategic resource management is to be held in Bahrain later this year.
- U.S.-based communications firm Lucent Technologies establishes regional Middle East and Africa headquarters in Bahrain.
- Telecommunications group AT&T is closing its Bahrain office, after a three-and-a-half year presence.
- Bahrain is to host an Arab jewelry exhibition in November. Around 200 firms are expected to take part in the event.
- Bahrain's chamber of commerce is to take part in trade talks with the European Union in France later this month.
- Commerce minister says Bahrain enjoys a good financial and banking position in the region.
